model: sig User { follows : set User, sees : set Photo, posts : set Photo, suggested : set User } sig Influencer extends User {} sig Photo { date : one Day } sig Ad extends Photo {} sig Day {}

requirements.description: Every photo is posted by one user
requirements.instances:
run Positive1 {
	some disj U1: User | some disj P1: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		posts = U1 -> P1
		date = P1 -> D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 1 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: The only photo is posted by exactly one user.

run Positive2 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1, P2: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		Influencer = U1
		Photo = P1 + P2
		Ad = P2
		Day = D1
		posts = U1 -> P1 + U2 -> P2
		date = P1 -> D1 + P2 -> D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: Each of the two photos is posted by a different, single user.

run Positive3 {
	some disj U1: User | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		no posts
		no date
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 1 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: The requirement is vacuously true as there are no photos.

run Negative1 {
	some disj U1: User | some disj P1: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		no posts
		date = P1 -> D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 1 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: Photo P1 is not posted by any user.

run Negative2 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		posts = U1 -> P1 + U2 -> P1
		date = P1 -> D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: Photo P1 is posted by two users, not one.

run Negative3 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1, P2: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		Influencer = U1
		Photo = P1 + P2
		Ad = P1
		Day = D1
		posts = U1 -> P1
		date = P1 -> D1 + P2 -> D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: Photo P2 is not posted by any user, while P1 is posted correctly.

requirements.description: Users can see ads posted by everyone, but only see non ads posted by followed users
If a user posts an ad then all its posts should be labeled as ads
requirements.instances:
run Positive1 {
	some disj D1: Day {
		no User
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		no follows
		no sees
		no posts
		no suggested
		no date
	}
} for 0 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: The requirement is vacuously true as there are no users.

run Positive2 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1, P2: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1 + P2
		Ad = P1 + P2
		Day = D1
		posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2
		date = Photo->D1
		no follows
		sees = User -> Ad
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: A user posts two photos, and both are ads, satisfying the requirement.

run Positive3 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		posts = U1->P1
		date = P1->D1
		follows = U2->U1
		sees = U2->P1
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: A user posts a photo, but since it is not an ad, the condition of the requirement is false.

run Negative1 {
	some disj U1: User | some disj P1, P2: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1 + P2
		Ad = P1
		Day = D1
		posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2
		date = Photo->D1
		no follows
		sees = U1->P1
		no suggested
	}
} for 1 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: A user posts one ad and one non-ad photo, violating the requirement.

run Negative2 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1, P2: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		Influencer = U1
		Photo = P1 + P2
		Ad = P1
		Day = D1
		posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2
		date = Photo->D1
		follows = U2->U1
		sees = User->P1 + U2->P2
		suggested = U1->U2
	}
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: An influencer posts an ad and a non-ad photo.

run Negative3 {
	some disj U1, U2: User | some disj P1, P2, P3: Photo | some disj D1: Day {
		User = U1 + U2
		no Influencer
		Photo = P1 + P2 + P3
		Ad = P1
		Day = D1
		posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2 + U2->P3
		date = Photo->D1
		follows = U1->U2
		sees = User->P1 + U1->P3
		no suggested
	}
} for 2 User, 3 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: One user posts an ad and a non-ad, while another user posts only a non-ad.

requirements.description: Influencers are followed by everyone else
Suggested are other users followed by followed users, but not yet followed
requirements.instances:
run Positive1 {
	some disj U1, U2, U3: User {
		User = U1 + U2 + U3
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		no Day
		follows = U1->U2 + U2->U3
		no posts
		no sees
		suggested = U1->U3
		no date
	}
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 0 Day expect 1 // U1 follows U2 and U2 follows U3, so U3 is correctly suggested to U1.

run Positive2 {
	some disj U1, U2, U3: User {
		User = U1 + U2 + U3
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		no Day
		follows = U1->U2 + U2->U1 + U2->U3
		no posts
		no sees
		suggested = U1->U3
		no date
	}
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 0 Day expect 1 // U1 follows U2, who follows U3. U3 is correctly suggested to U1. U2 has no suggestions as its only friend-of-friend is itself.

run Positive3 {
	some disj I1, U1, U2: User | some P1: Photo | some D1: Day {
		User = I1 + U1 + U2
		Influencer = I1
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		follows = U1->I1 + U2->I1 + I1->U1
		posts = I1->P1
		sees = U1->P1 + U2->P1
		suggested = U2->U1
		date = P1->D1
	}
} for 3 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // U2 follows influencer I1, and I1 follows U1. U1 is correctly suggested to U2.

run Negative1 {
	some disj U1, U2, U3: User {
		User = U1 + U2 + U3
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		no Day
		follows = U1->U2 + U2->U3
		no posts
		no sees
		no suggested
		no date
	}
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 0 Day expect 0 // U1 follows U2 and U2 follows U3, but U3 is not suggested to U1.

run Negative2 {
	some disj U1, U2, U3: User {
		User = U1 + U2 + U3
		no Influencer
		no Photo
		no Ad
		no Day
		follows = U1->U2 + U2->U3
		no posts
		no sees
		suggested = U1->U2
		no date
	}
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 0 Day expect 0 // U1 is suggested U2, but this is incorrect as U1 already follows U2.

run Negative3 {
	some disj I1, U1, U2: User | some P1: Photo | some D1: Day {
		User = I1 + U1 + U2
		Influencer = I1
		Photo = P1
		no Ad
		Day = D1
		follows = U1->I1 + U2->I1 + I1->U1
		posts = I1->P1
		sees = U1->P1 + U2->P1
		no suggested
		date = P1->D1
	}
} for 3 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // U2 follows influencer I1, who in turn follows U1. U1 should be suggested to U2, but is not.

requirements.description: A user only sees ads from followed or suggested users

model: sig Workstation { workers : set Worker, succ : set Workstation } one sig begin, end in Workstation {} sig Worker {} sig Human, Robot extends Worker {} abstract sig Product { parts : set Product } sig Material extends Product {} sig Component extends Product { workstation : set Workstation } sig Dangerous in Product {}

requirements.description: Workers are either human or robots
requirements.instances:
run Positive1 {
	// This is a positive instance because there are no workers, so the condition holds vacuously.
	no Worker
	no Human
	no Robot
	Workstation = begin + end
	no workers
	no succ
	no Product
	no Material
	no Component
	no Dangerous
	no parts
	no workstation
} for 2 Workstation, 0 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Positive2 {
	// This is a positive instance because the only worker is a Human.
	some disj W1 : Worker {
		Worker = W1
		Human = W1
		no Robot
		Workstation = begin + end
		workers = begin -> W1
		succ = begin -> end
		no Product
		no Material
		no Component
		no Dangerous
		no parts
		no workstation
	}
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Positive3 {
	// This is a positive instance because all workers are either Human or Robot.
	some disj W1, W2 : Worker {
		Worker = W1 + W2
		Human = W1
		Robot = W2
		Workstation = begin + end
		workers = begin -> W1 + end -> W2
		succ = begin -> end
		no Product
		no Material
		no Component
		no Dangerous
		no parts
		no workstation
	}
} for 2 Workstation, 2 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Negative1 {
	// This is a negative instance because there is a worker that is neither a Human nor a Robot.
	some disj W1 : Worker {
		Worker = W1
		no Human
		no Robot
		Workstation = begin + end
		workers = begin -> W1
		no succ
		no Product
		no Material
		no Component
		no Dangerous
		no parts
		no workstation
	}
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 0

run Negative2 {
	// This is a negative instance because W2 is a worker but is neither a Human nor a Robot.
	some disj W1, W2 : Worker {
		Worker = W1 + W2
		Human = W1
		no Robot
		Workstation = begin + end
		workers = begin -> W1 + end -> W2
		succ = begin -> end
		no Product
		no Material
		no Component
		no Dangerous
		no parts
		no workstation
	}
} for 2 Workstation, 2 Worker, 0 Product expect 0

run Negative3 {
	// This is a negative instance because W3 is a worker but is neither a Human nor a Robot.
	some disj W1, W2, W3 : Worker {
		Worker = W1 + W2 + W3
		Human = W1
		Robot = W2
		Workstation = begin + end
		workers = begin -> W1 + begin -> W2 + end -> W3
		succ = begin -> end
		no Product
		no Material
		no Component
		no Dangerous
		no parts
		no workstation
	}
} for 2 Workstation, 3 Worker, 0 Product expect 0
